sentences: Isabel Diana Colegate  (born 10 September 1931) is a British author and literary agent.

Born in Lincolnshire, Colegate’s father was Sir Arthur Colegate, while her mother was Winifred Mary, a daughter of Sir William Worsley, 3rd Baronet, and the widow of Captain Francis Percy Campbell Pemberton of the 2nd Life Guards, who had been killed in action in the First World War.
She was educated at Runton Hill School in Norfolk.
In 1952, Colegate, in partnership with Anthony Blond, set up the publishing firm, Anthony Blond (London) Ltd.
In 1953, Colegate married Michael Fenwick Briggs, and the couple have two sons and a daughter.
Isabel Colegate’s novel The Shooting Party (1980) was adapted as an award-winning film of the same name, released in 1985 by Castle Hill Productions Inc.
